content: This page includes books about [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). - Koninck, Rodolphe de; Drolet, Julie; Girard, Marc (2008). *Singapore: An Atlas of Perpetual Territorial Transformation*. NUS Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-9971-69-397-8. - Lee, Edwin (2008). *Singapore: The Unexpected Nation*. Institute of Southeast Asian Studies. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-230-796-5. - Frost, Mark Ravinder; Balasingamchow, Yu-Mei (19 February 2013). *Singapore: A Biography*. Editions Didier Millet. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-4385-16-9. - Hutton, Wendy (2007). *Singapore Food*. Marshall Cavendish. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-261-321-9. - [Leasor, James](/wiki/James_Leasor) (1 January 2001). *Singapore: The Battle That Changed the World*. House of Stratus. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-7551-0039-2. - Rau, Dana Meachen (2004). *Singapore*. Marshall Cavendish. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-7614-1727-9. - Palmer, John (2002). *Singapore*. Broken Jaw Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-1-896647-85-2. - Chong, Terence (2011). *The Theatre and the State in Singapore: Orthodoxy and Resistance*. Routledge. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-415-58448-7. - Ebrahim, Naleeza; Yee, Yaw Yan (2006). *Singapore*. Marshall Cavendish. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-232-922-6. - Eng, Lai Ah (2008). *Religious Diversity in Singapore*. Institute of Southeast Asian Studies. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-230-754-5. - Perry, Martin; Kong, Lily; Yeoh, Brenda S. A. (1997). *Singapore: a developmental city state*. Wiley. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-471-97190-0. - [Trocki, Carl A.](/wiki/Carl_A._Trocki) (2006). *Singapore: Wealth, Power and the Culture of Control*. Psychology Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-415-26386-3. - [Haas, Michael](/wiki/Michael_Haas_(political_scientist)) (1 January 1999). *The Singapore Puzzle*. Greenwood Publishing Group. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-275-96379-8. - Quah, Jon S. T. (2010). *Public Administration Singapore-style*. Emerald Group Publishing. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-1-84950-924-4. - Chua, Beng-Huat (1997). *Communitarian Ideology and Democracy in Singapore*. Psychology Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-415-16465-8. - Huff, W. G. (13 August 1997). *The Economic Growth of Singapore: Trade and Development in the Twentieth Century*. Cambridge University Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-521-62944-7. - Ng, Peter K. L.; Corlett, Richard; Tan, Hugh T. W. (2011). *Singapore Biodiversity: An Encyclopedia of the Natural Environment and Sustainable Development*. Editions Didier Millet. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-4260-08-4. - Afendras, Evangelos A.; Kuo, Eddie C. Y. (1980). *Language and Society in Singapore*. NUS Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-9971-69-016-8. - Barr, Michael D.; Skrbi≈°, Zlatko (2008). *Constructing Singapore: Elitism, Ethnicity and the Nation-building Project*. NIAS Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-87-7694-029-4. - Lim, Peter H. L. (2009). *Chronicle of Singapore, 1959-2009: Fifty Years of Headline News*. Editions Didier Millet. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-4217-75-0. - George, Cherian (2000). *Singapore: The Air-conditioned Nation : Essays on the Politics of Comfort and Control, 1990-2000*. Landmark Books. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-3065-46-8. - Chia, Lin Sien (1991). *The Biophysical Environment of Singapore*. NUS Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-9971-69-144-8. - Abshire, Jean (21 March 2011). *The History of Singapore*. ABC-CLIO. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-0-313-37743-3. - Yeoh, Brenda S. A. (January 2003). *Contesting Space in Colonial Singapore: Power Relations and the Urban Built Environment*. NUS Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-9971-69-268-1. - [Acharya, Amitav](/wiki/Amitav_Acharya) (December 2007). *Singapore's Foreign Policy: The Search for Regional Order*. World Scientific. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-277-034-9. - Heng, Derek Thiam Soon; Aljunied, Syed Muhd. Khairudin (2009). *Reframing Singapore: Memory, Identity, Trans-regionalism*. Amsterdam University Press. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-90-8964-094-9. - Tan, Kenneth Paul (2008). *Cinema and Television in Singapore: Resistance in One Dimension*. BRILL. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-90-04-16643-1. - Das, Sanchita Basu (3 August 2010). *Road to Recovery: Singapore's Journey Through the Global Crisis*. Institute of Southeast Asian Studies. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 978-981-4311-05-2. - Tan, Tai Yong (2019). *Seven hundred years: a history of Singapore*. Singapore: Marshall Cavendish Editions. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9814828106.
title: Bibliography of Singapore
